subject: Basketball
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Walter McCarty, a former Kentucky star who played 10 seasons in the N.B.A., has rejoined his mentor, Rick Pitino, as an assistant basketball coach at Louisville. “To be back here with him, it means a lot,” McCarty said yesterday. He played for Pitino in 1996, when Kentucky won the N.C.A.A. title.McCarty replaced Marvin Menzies, who was introduced yesterday as the head coach at New Mexico State. Menzies replaced Reggie Theus, another former assistant to Pitino at Louisville, who left to coach the Sacramento Kings. Theus rebuilt the New Mexico State program in two seasons.
